website_summaries.verdict: A classic-style Timex that sports a more functional look.
pros: Functional display includes 3 subdials and dual numerals for military time
Water-resistant build is good for small splashes or rain
The main time keeping display is easy to read in different lighting conditions
cons: The weight of the watch is heavier than other women's time pieces in the Timex lineup
Secondary hands can be difficult to read

customer_reviews.title: Good watch for the value and style
customer_reviews.text: The watch arrived timely and in good condition, the only complain is the package is not good enough to protect the original Timex gift box, minor chipped at one corner, but the watch inside is OK, so it is no good for gift but a good excuse for me to keep it to myself =} Overall a very good piece of watch under $100, I was a bit worry about others mentioning the quality of the NATO style watch straps, but the real thing looks just fine. Whoever invented NATO style watch straps is a genius, and this watch looks the best with this kind of straps
customer_reviews.author: Terrence Shen

customer_reviews.title: This was amazon 'open box' used item
customer_reviews.text: Usually, I give Timex, although inexpensive, a rate of 5 stars but not this time around. I don't know whether it did not keep good time or other stuff not working because it was used/open box or whether it was this class of Timex watches. To find the answer and bc I'm a big Timex fan, I returned this item (full credit) and bought a new Timex of same style. We shall see what happens next. I must commend amazon.com for their excellent (as usual) customer service! Thanks, amazon! Edited several wks later: new replacemt watch, same issues, not working! Return 2d watch for full refund. Keep 1 star review.
customer_reviews.author: dl8ch

customer_reviews.title: Simple yet dignified.
customer_reviews.text: Classy, functional, and quality. This has enough heft without being a burden, but still has the feel of a quality piece of hardware. Whether it is high quality or not I couldn't say. I'm not familiar with any other quality and am fine with that. I don't want to spend $500 on a watch that I might lose tomorrow when I can get this baby for less than $100.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Product, Terrible Warranty, Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch in January as a birthday gift for my husband. He noticed in March that the watch wasn't working and discovered that the crown (which sets/winds the watch) had fallen off. We were past the 30 day return limit to return it to Amazon. I contacted Time and was told for $30!! (I paid $53 for the watch), they would replace the crown. Specifically, the crown, face, and band are not covered under the time one year warranty. So now I have a broken $53 watch that was used for 2 months. A total piece of junk and the company clearly does not stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Chronograph feature is junk; don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Another good-looking, poorly functioning watch from Timex. It's the second I own that has broken in under two months (so the window to apply for a refund has closed). It's not totally broken. It still tells the time, and it still looks OK. But the chronograph is pretty badly screwed up. The hands won't rest in the right place. (See the picture, which shows where they come to rest.) If you really must buy a Timex watch, don't get one with a chronograph feature.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hart

customer_reviews.title: Easily the worst watch i've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I had a Timex Expedition when I was in middle school, and it was built like a tank. With the great memory, I decided to but another one to commemorate the good days with the old one. Yet, I was disappointed at the quality of this one; the strap was so fragile, and the hand was broken that didn't allow me to adjust the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amadeus

customer_reviews.title: Its cheap at least
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several Timex watches b/c they are cheap and I dont wear for fashion. Most of them fail some way very quickly and this one did not disappoint. Right out of the box the calendar did not work but no surprise there, this happened to most of Timex I have purchased. Now, after one week, the second hand quit working. Also the band is very thin and flimsy and I dont expect it to last much longer either. Dont Buy!
customer_reviews.author: BigFootie

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I have the Expedition version of this watch, too, and I much prefer the Weekender version. The Weekender is smaller, lighter, and has the NATO band, which is way, WAY more comfortable. I have always tried to wear a chronograph, and these Timex ones are accurate and function very well, and you don't need to fear damage so much as with a vintage chronograph. There is an adjustment procedure to make sure the hands line up properly and the watch functions correctly. These watches are a great value, look very nice, and are a great way to avoid damaging your nice watches and yet still wear a chrono.
customer_reviews.author: Dan'l

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable choice
customer_reviews.text: Always impressed with these weekenders. I have three different ones now. They’re solidly built and have a smooth feel about them. Nothing super swanky but not cheaply built. Good quality finishes. They are my go to watches for lots of uses. I do NOT take these in water, especially since they have fabric bands so don’t know much about their resistance but would believe they would be fine in light settings. The low lighting conditions are fine when you do a simple push of the adjuster pin because the whole face lights up a little and then you can see the time. Never had a chronograph before so wanted one.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Peter Duke

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for the ladies, too.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is a fantastic deal! I have had my eye out for an inexpensive fully-functional chronograph watch for a while and this is the one! Everything on mine works as it should. I love the looks of this watch, too. I have read reviews criticizing the thin watch band. However, I really like it as it is very comfortable (and it is indeed genuine leather). I have small hands and wrists and I think this watch looks awesome! For $35, you get a fully functional chronograph with reliable Timex quality.
customer_reviews.author: LSG

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for a clean understated look in a watch that can be had for a low price without looking cheap look no further. The weekender is a classic. *Edit. Two months after purchase the hour hand will not line up. The chrono has the same issue but was easily fixed. I called Timex customer service and they could not care less and said to let Amazon deal with it. Cheap junk watch, avoid at any cost.
customer_reviews.author: The Pro 47

customer_reviews.title: Received flawed, nice-looking watch
customer_reviews.text: The watch looks great, just what I was looking for. However, it did not work properly. The second hand does not move, and the date adjustment doesn't work. When trying to adjust the date, the hour hand moved. You can pull the crown out to two positions. Pulling it out to the first position allows you to adjust the date; the second position allows you to adjust the time. The time adjustment worked, but as I said, the date adjustment moved the hour hand. I am in the process of returning the watch. I'm going to give it another shot and reorder once my money has been refunded. Maybe the second time will be the charm.
customer_reviews.author: MeatMonkeyX

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not exceptional
customer_reviews.text: If not submerging in deep water (no diving) this is an acceptable watch for those needing a stopwatch (all a Chronograph function generally is). While slightly smaller in the face sizing than the newer Timex Expedition Field Chronograph (meaning not the older field Chronograph), it is quite a bit taller. The chrome is tacky as well. But the hands hold a light charge well, so you may receive 20 to 180 minutes of the hands illuminating if you had it in the sun for at least 30 minutes beforehand during the day. For the price, I can't argue with it. It's an acceptable watch.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID W.

customer_reviews.title: far exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: this is one of those purchases that stands out across a lifetime of consumer purchases. there are only a handful of other things that i have bought in my life where i just say, "wow." i can't believe that a watch so attractive can cost this little. the cream dial with tan band is very elegant but can be dressed down with a t-shirt and jeans. i have a lot of watches but this one is getting a lot of wear time. i cannot recommend this watch enough. i did read some of the other reviews about the watch not keeping time or issues with the chrono not working. i haven't had any issues in over 3 months of ownership.
customer_reviews.author: HEF

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but junk
customer_reviews.text: Just got this and the top right chrono dial resets to 1, not 0 as it should. The top left chronograph dial, which measures minutes, resets to off 0 as well. (See photo) This is unacceptable. The quality is garbage. This watch is very nice looking and I love the indiglo backlight, however I can not look at it with those dials being off like that. I had high hopes for this budget watch, but it looks like Timex has pretty bad quality control. I will be returning it and won't bother buying another. Given that this one is junk right out of the box, I doubt these will last. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch, absolutely terrible wristband.
customer_reviews.text: Good looking watch face and functions well, but terrible wristband. Although, I strongly advise NOT getting the slip-thru leather wrist band if possible. It's extremely thin and flimsy. I've only owned the watch for one week and the leather is splitting apart. I understand wrist band is easily replaceable, but I thought this one would last longer than at least a week. Avoid the leather slip-thru band completely.
customer_reviews.author: nadagen

customer_reviews.title: I love this watch
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. It looks great and it is a great starting point for anyone looking to get into Horology. Or maybe you just wan't a great looking watch and don't want to spend a ton of money. The only thing that is not great is the strap, but at this price point, that should be expected. I got a replacement strap and for a total still less than $50, you have a jam up watch! For sizing, I have 7.5" wrists and it fits me just fine. It is a little on the small side for my tastes, but I would still recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Benton

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, has minor issues
customer_reviews.text: Pro's: 40mm, looks nice, interchangeable bands, easy to read, and I can wear this with jeans, shorts, or even slacks. Cons: Stop watch doesn't work properly and the indiglo light doesn't always work properly. The first day I had this watch I would push the indiglo button and it would light up and stay lit for a few seconds. Now I have to hold it down. Neither of these issues will cause me to return the watch. Overall I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice timepiece with minor flaws. Band is uncomfortable with daily wear.
customer_reviews.text: Solid time piece. The chronograph is not intuitive and often needs to beamually recalibrated to zero out properly. I also find it odd that the second hand of the main face is designated for the Chrono and the small dial in the middle is the second hand for the watch. Additionally, the band which comes with the watch rubs my skin in several spots creating irritation. This occurs at the clasp and where the buckles for the NATO band are looped. I love the timeless look of the face, though and will be keeping with a new band.
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great time piece, invest in some new straps
customer_reviews.text: Soo.. the watch itself is nice, the case feels a little cheap and the chrome hands can be hard to pick up at times. But ascetically it’s a good looking watch. The bands however or straps are basically for looks and are of the lowest quality.. if you plan on wearing this watch for any duration of time invest in a a better quality strap. The ones that come with this watch are extremely thin, flimsy, and clearly of low quality materials.. but for the price point and chronograph feature I can’t knock it too bad.. just be aware of it. All in all watch itself functions nicely and gets a lot of looks!
customer_reviews.author: billy

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and useful.
customer_reviews.text: The best causal/formal watch i got. It is my go to watch, ant get tired of using it. Feels and looks stylish, i've gotten a lot of compliments when wearing it, the best part is that you can make it look different every time just by changing the straps. The leather one that comes with it is really comfortable but it stains easily. I bought another one as it went form tan to brown, guess it was the use nor the soap. I highly recommend this watch for daily use as a casual watch, although it works for semi formal events as well.
customer_reviews.author: Romer

customer_reviews.title: So good I keep buying it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. After researching hundreds of watches I bought this one. I’ll never own another watch. I’m pretty brutal on my watches. I wear them every day weather I’m just going to work, at the beach, or dirt biking through the Rocky Mountains. This watch holds up. It’s stylish, affordable, comfortable, and durable. I’ve accidentally worn it into the shower several times and even taken it swimming and it’s held up great. After a few years the leather starts to wear out and I buy another one. I’ll never buy anything else!
customer_reviews.author: Cody Rosenbalm

customer_reviews.title: Something"s Just Not Right
customer_reviews.text: The product delivered seemed to be what was advertised; however, it was far from what one would expect. The minute and hour hands should be synchronized. When the minute hand is at the 12 o'clock position the hour hand should point squarely and precisely at a distinct hour; that was not the case with this watch. It's useless as a timepiece; maybe as a weird style of bracelet that does nothing other than act as though it's a watch.
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and practical
customer_reviews.text: Best of both worlds: a really good looking and practical watch. Love the calendar function and the chronograph is great for timing how long it takes to complete small tasks and chores. Only weird thing to me is that the large seconds hand is for the chronograph feature, and the small seconds hand is the actual time-keeping hand. Like.... why tf wouldn't all the small dials be associated with the chronograph and all the large dials be associated with the current time? Regardless, great watch.
customer_reviews.author: Miles B.

customer_reviews.title: Is There Such A Thing As Too Supple?
customer_reviews.text: f buy watches the way the low-brow wealthy with aspirations buy art — because the color matches something. So this watch is great — a green face, a tan band. I enjoy it, I wear it, it works (and, of course, it also works). A nice design touch on the band — the silver bars and the whole toggle-y set-up in the money bit of the watch. Only complaint is the band is perhaps TOO soft. Nearly all to the good but I am worried I'll be replacing it soon. (The band, not the watch, which I like.)
customer_reviews.author: Poet And Priest

customer_reviews.title: Great, classic watch
customer_reviews.text: I had an old swiss army watch from my mom I loved, but despite repair attempts it kept terrible time. This has a lot of the same look with some nice, modern features (like the backlight). And the included NATO style band is great, though I swapped it for a canvas one for now, an easy switch. I'm not a fan of big, chunky men's watches, and the face of this is a perfect size. It's a little thick (probably to accommodate the quartz mechanism?) but not too heavy or anything otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary P. Wussow

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I like this watch quite a lot. The dark numbers against the light colored face is easiest for my old eyes. The timer’s sub-dials work perfectly (timed against my iPhone) and reset to dead zero every time. The indiglo feature is fantastic, particularly bright on this watch. I haven’t tested its water resistance, but based on other Timex watches I’ve owned I’m confident it’s good. Great watch, well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Wm B

customer_reviews.title: An Everyday Watch Thats Anything but Average!
customer_reviews.text: Received this watch about 2 months ago (Today is 6/7/17) and i have worn it everyday since, and absolutely love it! Having just started wearing watches last year, i didnt know much about them, but i researched and found this Timex Weekender, and it has worked like a charm and its great looking! I even took it out fishing on the Gulf Coast, and it worked! Dunked in salt-water, floating down a channel, it is still going strong! Lights Up Bright too!!! definitely will buy another Timex!!!!
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Very stylish and functional. at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I have the model with an off-white face and black leather band with contrasting stitching. I don't expect to use the stopwatch feature but it's nice to have just in case. I'm particularly happy with Timex's Indiglo backlighting that makes for great nighttime visibility. The "instructions"that come with the watch are a throwaway. It's necessary to view the on-line video that demonstrates chronograph and settings. I'm very happy with this watch and with Timex in general.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Bielecki

customer_reviews.title: the NATO strap very comfortable and the look is way beyond the price
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today and I find this watch to be such an incredible value. The set-up was simple, the NATO strap very comfortable and the look is way beyond the price. It is very light and you hardly feel it on your wrist, but when you hold it feels very study and well made. I will be getting these in different colors and will be a great part of my growing collection. You have to keep in mind the price. The Chrono is only good for 30 minutes (but you shouldn't have purchased this if you wanted a full featured Chrono). It is hard to believe that you can get a watch that is this good for such little money.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Pepe

customer_reviews.title: Never again.
customer_reviews.text: Chronograph is good but acts up and moves around on its own. I have to reset every time I want to use the chronograph. Just save 50-60 dollars more for one that isn’t a timex. My Casio world time is better then this and it was $5 with shipping. Never used the band looked and felt very cheap. To light for the watch it is on.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: and this has lasted and performed like the best of them
customer_reviews.text: Such a stylish watch and band set. I am very picky when it comes to purchasing things, and I rely heavily on reviews, that being said, this is definitely worth the purchase! My husband loves being able to switch out the bands depending on his outfit, and the navy face is very sleek! This watch is large enough to look substantial and expensive without being chunky and heavy. My husband is usually a little tough on his things, and this has lasted and performed like the best of them! We are both very happy with this watch. I honestly have no complaints, and almost 8 months later, still find my eyes drawn to his watch, and find myself admiring it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Davis

customer_reviews.title: Overall, satisfied with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this watch for about 7 months now, the band holds up nicely and is still relatively stiff. I only have 2 complaints about the watch: 1. being something already mentioned from other reviewers, to adjust the date, you need to wind the minute hand all the way around, there's no separate adjustment for the date 2. the watch is quite thick Besides that, the watch is very nice for the price. I've received many compliments on it, and I think the color combination of the dark blue watch face and the brown band goes very nice together.
customer_reviews.author: yeffkelly

customer_reviews.title: Attactive, but hands are hard to see
customer_reviews.text: I like the overall appearance of the watch. It works well and the Indiglo light is nice. I have not yet purchased another band, though I see that as one of the best features - the ability to change the appearance inexpensively and easily. The only real downside to the watch is that the hands are not easy to read depending on the lighting you are in. The silver/chrome color is reflective. Also, the stopwatch second hand (the large one that rests on the 12 when not in use) can cause you to mistake the time because it looks like the hour hand.
customer_reviews.author: K. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Good looking quartz watch for under $50
customer_reviews.text: There isn't too much I can say about this watch because there really wasn't anything unexpected. It easy to read, accurate, and looks great. It was a little bit bulkier than I had imagined but not so much that it looks obnoxious. As others have said, the strap does leave a lot to be desired. It's a little thin and cheap feeling but that just seems to be the way it goes with these cheap watches. It can easily be improved with a $10 strap but the one it comes with is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome watch, TImex is a great deal for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome watch, TImex is a great deal for the price, looks great, perfect sporty preppy watch. Band is clearer than the one in the picture but looks great is also thin, but that is good, thick leather bands are not good for NATO straps model, true it will wear off often but you can replace it easily and without expending a fortune.
customer_reviews.author: Hispaniolo

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Indiglo and Chronograph
customer_reviews.text: While I love the dial design, this watch had enough flaws upon first inspection that I immediately repackaged and returned it. 1. Chronograph issue — after just a few tests of the chronograph function, I found that the minute subdial was off-kilter at reset. 2. Indiglo issue — the Indiglo engaged when I pushed the chronograph plungers, but my understanding/expectation is that it should only engage when pushing the main crown. 3. Thickness — This isn’t a defect, but I simply wanted to mention that the watch case is VERY thick, and definitely feels that way. Too thick for my 6 inch wrist. Of course, that’s on me for not researching that closely enough, but still worth mentioning.
customer_reviews.author: Marc M

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Strap Slightly Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I like the style of this watch, its size, weight and apparent accuracy. I would knock it one star is because of the strap, but read on... While the strap looks nice and I like the colour, it is thin and feels cheap. After less than 2 months of intermittent wear, there is a separation between the top and bottom layers. For a $50 watch I am not terribly surprised, but still, just be aware. I plan on buying additional, various straps.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Dunbar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, affordable Chrono
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected. I wanted a chrono that was affordable that would match anything, without being too thick. Most are 11mm+, which I don't like. This is just the right size. Light is great. If you push and hold for a few seconds, the light will stay on for a couple of seconds each time you press, instead of having to hold the button down when you want the light on. I nice little feature I didn't know about. Hands are on dials, chrono works well. Pleased with purchase, good seller.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rockwell

customer_reviews.title: Decent watch
customer_reviews.text: The watch is attractive and has a very classic look. The face color is a very dark blue that appears black in most lighting conditions. The leather NATO strap that's included feels very cheap. It's very thin and I'm not overly impressed (will probably order an aftermarket leather strap in a similar color. The blue NATO strap that's included is the better of the 2 straps. Overall, decent watch with good looks.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin F Mayhorn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing watch, but I replaced the watch band almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this watch. It is slightly smaller than what I'm used to (coming from a Samsung Gear S3), but nothing to complain about. The built-in light is very useful and doesn't detract from being able to tell time. I wasn't a fan of the watch band so I replaced it with a Barton 20mm watch band, and it makes the watch feel more impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Nice Looking,  Troubled Movement
customer_reviews.text: Great looking watch, however I have had trouble with it keeping time. I don't know if it is a bad battery or the movement is not working properly. Every few hours the hands stop and it no longer works. To get it moving again I have to reset the time. The funny thing is the chronograph and indiglo still work. I am going to get a new battery put in and see if that fixes it.
customer_reviews.author: ColdSmoke80

customer_reviews.title: I love the fit and
customer_reviews.text: The Timex Weekender is a throw back to some watches made decades ago. I love the fit and, for the money, I love the look of a watch that could easily cost 3-4 times as much. That said there are a couple of drawbacks I must conquer. Setting the watch requires one pull of the stem for hours and another pull for changing the minutes. I struggled a bit with pull number two- felt like I would yank the stem free of the watch. Also, my hour hand falls between 3 and 4, then 4 and 5- confusing! I am going to reset the watch tonight and will update the post. Crazy good price though, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful watch at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of them, one for me and one for my son. Both have problem in stop watch function(the 'stop watch hands' do not align exact position after reset button pushed) but they keep perfect time and quite water proof(I showers often with on it). SS case is well polished and retain beautiful luster after a few months rough use.
customer_reviews.author: KY Song the caveman

customer_reviews.title: Total crap
customer_reviews.text: After only three and a half months the stem fell off of this crappy watch rendering it useless. I made the mistake of buying this my second one thinking when the same thing happened before it was a fluke. Do not waste your money on this throw away watch
customer_reviews.author: BrielleBill

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, but having some trouble with the time function
customer_reviews.text: Shipped fast, and looks great on my boyfriends wrist. The fit is nice too, even though he has pretty thick wrists. The band is quite thin, but since it's real leather it's sturdy. The light looks great and makes everything easy to read in any light, and the timer is really cool - when it works. It works fine, but the top left dial is stuck one minute (hour?) in. This was after testing the feature twice. The time will start at 1 instead of 0 now and still works though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High functioning for a simple girl!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful watch! Beware of all of the functions! It does so much that you may think it is broken. Sounds dumb but it's true. I opened the watch was setting the time and got distracted everything seemed to work. Got back to it the next day and only the hour hand moved...the button was not pulled out far enough. After that I realized the second hand wasn't ticking. Read a timed forum and that's a normal quirk or feature of this watch it only ticks for up to four hours when the chronograph or stopwatch is on. I was in the middle of processing a return when I decided to give it another shot! Google before you return!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffanie Markle

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking watch! Modern and also useful. I will be buying another band strap because is very easy to change them. But beware, if considering leather, better stick with the Timex straps because the others are very bulky. I ordered two from different sellers and yes, they are cheaper but don't look the same. Timex should have more color alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Thinkerball

customer_reviews.title: It looks like a toy watch even from afar
customer_reviews.text: Terrible value for money: the worst possible quality for sixty-five dollars. It looks like a toy watch: crown with a very hard touch, the dial is a simple printed paper, the hands are of poor quality, the nato strap is stiff, uncomfortable and of very low quality. Indiglo works well (the only positive thing). Sincerely, I wish I was wrong but I don't think it works for a long time. For this price and even less there are much more advisable options: vostok, seiko, orient, casio...
customer_reviews.author: Joe A. Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Great! Just don't get a defective one
customer_reviews.text: Non of the times subdials reset to zero (they reset to picture shown) -even the chronographs second hand was off. Could not adjust date. The light came on when clicking the the start timer button. Looked great though. Just want one that works and isn't defective. Watch band is for crap. Order a new one right out of the box
customer_reviews.author: Caryn Fox

customer_reviews.title: Expensive -looking and very good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect casual watch. Looks good on both genders. I bought one for me and then bought a second for my dad. We both love them and get many compliments. It looks more expensive than it is, which is great. My only beef with it is that the second hand has to be restarted every day. But who needs that anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth H

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels like a more expensive watch.
customer_reviews.text: Frankly I don't have a need for a chronograph, but I like the way it looks. I made sure it worked properly when I got it, because the first one I ordered didn't. For an affordable watch, I have to say the fit and finish has the feel of a more expensive option. It has a timeless, classic look I think I'll enjoy for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Pennick

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, Cheap Strap
customer_reviews.text: Great watch. The strap could be better. It's leather is very thin and I can't help but feel like it is going to break. Most leather straps are doubled up and stitched. This single piece of split leather is folded over on half the strap and only stitched in places to hold the rings and buckle. I will be making my own strap. The timepiece itself is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great Style, Amazing Value
customer_reviews.text: Great style, lots of compliments. Hands could be easier to read if slightly bigger and brighter. Light should stay on longer, but I realize its designed to save battery life. They should consider an update with improved readability and solar / light charging
customer_reviews.author: JCP

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Great watch.  Easy changeable straps.
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice watch, takes a lickin and keeps on tickin' ;-D The face of the watch is nice, and I really like the strap system, it is extremely easy to switch up between sporty and classy straps to make your watch go with your outfits in many different settings, without having to bring multiple watches on a trip. I purchased it for a decent quality, nice looking., reliable watch... specifically for travel overseas. And it has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. It is beautifully designed and quite sturdy. It keeps time well and is very functional. However, it does have two major flaws in my personal experience. First, the watch strap, though genuine leather is very thin. Becuase of this it tends to curl and loose its shape. Second, the minute dial on my particular watch's chronograph functions does not work and never has. I believe it may have been a odd, luck of the draw. Other than these two issues, the watch is flawless.
customer_reviews.author: The Mustache

customer_reviews.title: Great fashionable watch for a low price.
customer_reviews.text: Great looking and functional watch for a great price. The band is a bit thin but strong enough and looks great. The watch keeps pretty accurate time and the date function is helpful. I get a lot of compliments on the watch when I have it on. The only minor complaint is that the watch body is on the thick side but it’s not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Meng-yeu Wang

customer_reviews.title: Love this watxh
customer_reviews.text: Great deal and Timex are still the best inexpensive watches out there. Everything works properly. The crystal Broke within a week though. I don’t remember banging it against anything though I may have. I’m trying to Find a place to repair it now. But for under $40 it may just be less expensive to just buy another. Love the way it looks and feels Though.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Robbins

customer_reviews.title: NIce looking watch, but the movement broke
customer_reviews.text: This was a great looking watch and the timex weekender is one of my favorites. However, the movement on this watch broke on me. The hour hand would no longer move. I tried to contact customer service and they told me to send it to them. But they sent it back and said that nothing was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Great Daily Watch
customer_reviews.text: Easy to swap straps. Great watch face. I'm very happy for this being a casual day watch. With the leather band, it can be worn out on nicer occasions. Wouldn't try to pull it off with a suit though, but anything more casual than that and you're good to go!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, cheap finishes.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with the finish. The photos make it look matte but when it arrived it was obviously chromed metal which looks very cheap. The design and characters are very nice. The belt is terribly cheap looking and is only paper thin leather over plastic.
customer_reviews.author: RPG

customer_reviews.title: Large but nice watch
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how large this watch was -- how thick it was. I guess I was expecting a more unisex size. But after wearing it a couple of times decided I liked it. I like how easy it is to read. It works fine. I got it to give my best watch a break on days off.
customer_reviews.author: Becky A.

customer_reviews.title: It’s an excellent watch. Did that please the amazon overlords? Can I go back to my life now?
customer_reviews.text: I like the watch. Wanted to just give it 5 stars because it met all my expectations but amazon insists I dance like a monkey on a string. It keeps the time. It works well as a timer. The instructions are clear and easy to follow and remember. I hope this pleases the amazon overlords and they won’t enslave me for their arena of death where they force customers to fight to the death for their amusement.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Its a good watch for the money. The Timex quality is still there, it seems well made.
customer_reviews.text: This is an old style, small case watch NOT a big case and dial. works well, looks good but understated. Perfect for and active person that glances at their wrist once in a while for the time. The indiglo function is nice and works well thus far.
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful watch!
customer_reviews.text: This was on my husband's Amazon Christmas list and he picked a good one! It's a really nice looking watch with a gorgeous leather band. He's never really been a watch wearing guy, but he loves this one and it looks really great on! Of course it's Timex so I'm confident it will hold up for the long haul.
customer_reviews.author: AngelMCM

customer_reviews.title: I get a ton of compliments (mostly from people who ...
customer_reviews.text: I get a ton of compliments (mostly from people who thinks it’s a Shinola). This is my second one, though, because the first got water inside it and was ruined. I didn’t submerge it in water, just normal life. I’m more conscience of it now, and this one has already outlasted my first!
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch
customer_reviews.text: I love it!! It came in yesterday. It’s perfect. I have small female wrists and it’s not too heavy. It’s my new favorite accessory. I don’t know if it’s waterproof and I’m not trying to test that. Very comfortable and very good looking.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Great looking watch, I wear it constantly.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this watch. I wear it all the time. The leather strap was a lot thinner than I thought it would be, but that also makes it quite comfortable. The watch seems to be very sturdy and is the perfect size for an average height male with fairly lean/fit arms. The strap will probably need to be replaced before the watch, but there are plenty of cool options online at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Great  Chronograph for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is my daily wear watch. In my profession, I don’t need an expensive watch; however, it needs to be stylish and reliable. Timex has a long history of watch making and this watch is a testament to that. If I had one complaint, it would be the leather strap band isn’t the highest quality. However, 20 mm nato straps can’t easily be changed out on this watch. The indigo light is fantastic. It’s a 40 mm watch, so it’s not huge on the wrist, but looks very nice and gets noticed. And no, the chronograph weekender doesn’t tick like the other weekenders. It’s a great watch for the price.
customer_reviews.author: David Rankin

customer_reviews.title: Never Again with Timex
customer_reviews.text: Happy enough with the style but it quit telling time after 5 days. The other features worked, but the second, minute, and hour hands stopped advancing. I've had a couple other Timex analog watches and they've all died prematurely.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Great casual watch!!
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this watch to anyone from a watch enthusiasts to casual wearer. It's a gorgeous looking watch. The watch looks pricer and has a higher quality feel than the image. Yes, it also has a little weight to it. This watch will be my go-to casual watch! Also, I would advice to buy a couple of additional straps for added variety. I have the brown leather and blue nylon straps.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Tuckler

customer_reviews.title: Nice relaible watch for the money
customer_reviews.text: Like many men, I own several watches. My other chronograph is a high-end dress watch and a gift from my wife. This Timex is for everyday and has one feature the dress watch does not: the indigo light. I like Timex watches for durability and price. If a Timex gets trashed or lost, it doesn't break my heart. It just gets replaced by another Timex.
customer_reviews.author: Kile

customer_reviews.title: However I find it very comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: The watch is what I expected. It is inexpensive and works well. The watch band is a little different and is very thin and soft. However I find it very comfortable to wear. I don't know how long the watch band will last, but it will be easy to replace. I find the band to be more comfortable than the NATO or rubber watchbands. The Indiglo function is better to see the watch at night than most of the glow in the night of other watches. The 1/20 chonograph subdial seems to me a useless function. I find most chonograph funtion to be useless, but it looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Resistant and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great watch for the price you're paying; looks good and wears good, draws the attention so it gives you things to talk about. Pros - Not too big - Easy to read - Built in light is very bright in the night - Can be used with almost every type of clothing but formal (of course) Cons - Case thickness could be lower - The original NATO band could be a bit thicker - Sometimes the cronograph hands don't allign with the indicators automatically when reset. That can be fixed manually pressing the button several times, however, shouldn't be necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Rivera

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Mine was dead on arrival and the packaging was damaged. Even if it worked OK, the watch is bulky and heavy. Your arm will have a good workout when you wear it. Also, the band is thin and flimsy. I returned mine for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: Decent watch
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking for the price. Leather band is a bit thin. Blue band is nice. Fits well, but was a pain to set the dials and get it functioning. Ended up ok but took a few tries. Indigo has a band not covered at bottom. Doesn’t affect reading just looks off.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R.

customer_reviews.title: Don't spend your money expecting a quality product here.
customer_reviews.text: Watch overall feels very cheap. Band is thinnest I have ever had around my wrist. Feels like will break just putting watch on. No provision to adjust date without turning time forward relentlessly. Waterproofing only good for splashes. Come on guys, this is a weekender field watch.... I would not buy another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Robbins Jr

customer_reviews.title: Very well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The watch is very accurate and easy to read, especially in the dark with the indigo. The band looks like fake leather but is stamped genuine leather.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Eugene L. Hirsch

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read, easy to customize.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for everyday wear. It’s slightly heavier than I expected, but not unmanageable. The dial is easy to read and the timer function is easy to use. I have always liked Timex watches (I have worn an Expedition for the last 16 years.) and find myself just as pleased with this one as the others I have owned. The NATO style band is easy to swap and I usually have a couple on hand in case it gets too dirty at work. The date is a little difficult to read under Indiglo, but I don’t have any other complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney K.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this watch
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Keeps time well. The timer is off zero. The seconds, minutes and milliseconds are all off zero. That's the entire point of buying a chronometer is to keep an accurate time with the stopwatch function. The regular time keeps decent but the hour hand is a bit off too. Junk watch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for the value so far.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, cheaper watch. I purchased the two straps and haven’t tried the weave only the leather. The only drawback to the leather strap is it is thin but kinda nice in that it doesn’t dig into my skin. And it can’t look too cheap really when I’ve had a doctor comment on it’s looks. I love the large face.
customer_reviews.author: Nbentwar

customer_reviews.title: Nice Watch
customer_reviews.text: This watch is very nice. I have a few other Timex with the Indiglo light up dial and they are great. These have a history for durability and craftsmanship for their price point. I love the styling and the double-layered leather band.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Davies

customer_reviews.title: Timex doesn't disappoint.
customer_reviews.text: Timex always provides durable watches, but I was somewhat taken back by this one. The strap is thin and feels cheap. Luckily replacements are affordable. The blue face with brown band and silver hardware looks stylish. It isn't a watch I would wear with a suit but it looks great for everyday use. This was also my first watch where the second hand doesn't actually tell time. It's part of the chronograph function, and the functioning second hand that always moves is the smallest hand at the 6 o'clock position. It's comfortable and Timex is always a good brand, but I felt that the strap should have been a better quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Seemed good, but turned out to be defective
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this watch when I first got it, but after less than two weeks, two of the chronograph hands stopped resetting properly. I've contacted Timex to see if there is a fix, but have only gotten automated responses back saying someone should be in touch with me within a day (3 days ago). I may just return the watch to Amazon and look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Tex

customer_reviews.title: ... this on another person (the blue version) and really liked it. Never had a watch with the NATO ...
customer_reviews.text: Saw this on another person (the blue version) and really liked it. Never had a watch with the NATO band and I have really liked it thus far. Nice weight. Indiglo is a nice touch. Also like that I can put other bands on it. Getting it's blue sibling this week...stoked!
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, but hands fall out of alignment, band tears after barely six months.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, but the hour hand is too far ahead of the minute hand. For example, when it's 5:20PM, the hour hand is nearly at the 6--that is, the position it should be in when it's about 5:50PM, not 5:20PM; or when it's 12:00PM, the hour hand is slightly *past* the 12 mark. 7-month update: The band has started to tear in half and the second hand is now off as well.
customer_reviews.author: mfriedmann4

customer_reviews.title: Broken second hand
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I’ve purchased this watch. The first one lasted a year and warranted many compliments. Unfortunately the second hand arrived broken on the most recent purchase. I was hoping to replace the watch as I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: E. C. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch
customer_reviews.text: Nice budget priced watch, so far its keeping time, the big second hand keeps stopping ,due too bumping of the push buttons, this does not affect the time tho
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and Resilient Watch, Band is fine.
customer_reviews.text: Great looking watch, I've gotten compliments from multiple people. Resilient (I've bumped it on a couple things, and it only has a tiny tiny scratch on the face, I'm surprised it doesn't have more). **Band seemed a little "stretchy", switched it out for another leather band.
customer_reviews.author: Roarbark

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The hands are not aligned. For instance, if 1000 straight up, the hands show halfway between 10 and 11. Took to local repair shop and repair would be $50, so not even worth the repair. Guess you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Henry G. Nadeau

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great watch. It is cheap, has a chronometer and has indiglo if you push the crown in. Wears well with jeans or office clothes. Can be dressed up or down. It is a staple in my watch collection.
customer_reviews.author: Donquique

customer_reviews.title: As Expected
customer_reviews.text: For its price, this watch is attractive and useful. The watch band seems to be quite thin, but it fits comfortably and will not be expensive to replace. I use the chronograph feature to time events that do not require a greater degree of accuracy than this watch provides. I think it is well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: W. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Pretty watch, worthless watchband.
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch for the price. The band however is absolute garbage. It feels like it's made out of compressed paper. I guess that's why they embossed it with the words "GENUINE LEATHER" so we don't think otherwise. I wouldn't trust it for more than a week to keep it on my wrist. I'll be finding a replacement band immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Dedalus2k

customer_reviews.title: My new daily watch!
customer_reviews.text: I get compliments constantly, asking if this is a Shinola or something that costs 10x the price. Love the glow feature and the chronographs. Goes great with brown shoes and belt.
customer_reviews.author: SEMichigander

customer_reviews.title: Very stylish and reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: Love the style of the watch face and really cool changeable straps, of which I purchased a second package. A little weird to have the second hand in a smaller dial section...and timer second hand where you would usually expect the regular second hand, but love it just the same. Great watch for a very reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: TallyJA2

customer_reviews.title: I really love this watch
customer_reviews.text: I really love this watch. It has a classic style and is at a price point that does not make you look like a sucker. My initial reaction was that it looked better in person than online. I still really think the pictures can't do it justice. It is really sharp. Several people have mentioned the same when they have seen me wearing it. Really comfortable too.... And the indiglo feature is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive great watch!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for a family member. Broke 1 year later after taking a few good whacks. Cheap enough so bought them another. They are happy once again. Liked so much that I got one for me too. Best watch! Really love it and the price!
customer_reviews.author: A Reader

customer_reviews.title: Don't even bother with these.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. Should be sold as a $5 joke of a watch for a toddler. It broke immediately upon trying to set the time. I pulled the pin to adjust minutes/hours and it snapped off. Cheap awful leather strap too thin to trust not to rip. A completely waste of money and complete trash product.
customer_reviews.author: EzAudio

customer_reviews.title: The watch still looks great and functions for time and date
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch based on reviews, looks and price. Not quite sure yet, but I believe the chronograph function on my watch doesn't work. Pressing the buttons has not yielded the same result twice yet, and so far the chronograph hasn't run. The watch didn't come with instructions for the chronograph function, so I found some online. Followed those and its still not working. I'm giving this watch 3 stars because I was hoping for some cheap chronograph functionality. The watch still looks great and functions for time and date.
customer_reviews.author: K. Carr

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice looking watch but I was disappointed to present a ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as a birthday gift and it arrived broken, with a box that didn't seem to be the original and no manual. It's a nice looking watch but I was disappointed to present a broken watch in a random box to my fiancé. Hopefully replacement will be much better.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Gratton

product_meta.title: Timex Weekender Chronograph 40mm Watch
product_meta.description:
You just found the only watch you'll ever need. A timeless chronograph that let's you change up leather and nylon straps for the season, the occasion or even your mood.




PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :5 x 5 x 0.7 inches; 2.24 Ounces
 * Item model number :TWC063500
 * Department :Unisex
 * Batteries :1 Lithium Metal batteries required. (included)
 * Date First Available :October 20, 2016
 * Manufacturer :Timex
 * ASIN :B01JO766FW

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #12,526 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry)  *  #32 inMen's Wrist Watches 
    *  #3224 inMen's Shops 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.3 out of 5 stars2,405 ratings You just found the only watch you'll ever need. A timeless chronograph that let's you change up leather and nylon straps for the season, the occasion or even your mood.
feature_bullets: Adjustable tan 20mm double-layered genuine leather slip-thru strap fits up to 8-inch wrist circumference
Cream dial with date window at 4 o'clock; full Arabic numerals; 24-hour military time
Silver-tone 40mm brass case with mineral glass crystal; Indiglo light-up watch dial; luminous hands
Water resistant to 30m (100ft): in general, withstands splashes or brief immersion in water, but not suitable for swimming or bathing
